contentList.content: On the back of this medallion is scratched an inscription: "To Garekh - from Tomarik. â€˜For this glorious victory, live long and happy!'" A huge ruby perfectly complements the composition of this jewelry, which sometimes glistens with unnatural light. You immediately notice it has magical properties.

A faint scarlet glow emanates continuously from the gemstone set in this pendant. It appears to be enchanted, imbuing the wearer with incredible strength. You've never encountered such a raw source of power and so you decide the pendant will stay with you.
You gain +[1](but no more than [2]) to Strength and Advantage on Strength Saving Throws.

This immaculately preserved artifact appears to have held immense significance among the Bull Cultists, likely belonging to their leader. As you grasp the amulet, an unwavering determination floods your being, a clear indication of the enchantment woven into this piece of jewelry.
You gain +[1](but no more than [2]) to Constitution and Advantage on Constitution Saving Throws.

The elven craftsmanship and worn scuffs on this pendant suggest its previous owner was a ranger. Finely crafted and featuring a massive emerald, this jewelry exudes an uncanny power. As you wear it, you sense the very winds themselves bestowing favor upon your movements.
You gain +[1](but no more than [2]) to Dexterity and Advantage on Dexterity Saving Throws.

The distinctly potent aura radiating from this small pendant suggests it once belonged to a formidable magician who enchanted it for fellow practitioners. Remarkably, the pendant inexplicably expands in size when worn.
You gain +[1](but no more than [2]) to Intelligence and Advantage on Intelligence Saving Throws.

This trinket is crafted from the bone of an extinct creature, a testament to its ancient origins. The amulet, by the looks of it, has endured for over a millennium. When you hold it in your hands, a curious surge of echoes stirs within you, suggesting the presence of spirits from the artifact's past owners.
You gain +[1](but no more than [2]) to Wisdom and Advantage on Wisdom Saving Throws.

From time immemorial, this pendant adorned the highest caste of ambassadors and diplomats, a treasured heirloom passed through generations. Its exquisite design reflects the requests of ancient royal dynasties. A profound surge of confidence courses through you as you make contact with the pendant.
You gain +[1](but no more than [2]) to Charisma and Advantage on Charisma Saving Throws.

As you gaze upon the ever-shifting white sands within the clear gem set in this amulet, a tiny magical inscription emerges on its back: "Let it be known to all that this item once belonged to a traitor and outcast. The wizard who wielded it was so formidable that he sealed his abominable magic within this piece of jewelry - a choice that led to his demise when we stole it and vanquished him." It becomes apparent that this artifact indeed possesses incredible power.

You gain Resistance to[1], Devil's Sight and no more than once per turn guaranteed to inflict [2] with your attacks on foes in combat, even if you miss.

Effectiveness increases each level.

An exquisitely crafted dragon-shaped amulet of mysterious origin. It exudes a potent enchantment, evident in its glowing eyes and comforting warmth. It likely served as a tool for an ancient civilization skilled in dragon taming. Historians would marvel at its discovery.
You gain Resistance to[1] and cannot catch fire. You need to roll [2] less to score Critical Hit (stacks with similar effects).

It's nearly impossible to avert one's gaze from the mesmerizing depths of this enchanting piece of jewelry. A single glance is enough to become lost within the mysteriously pure magic emanating from this pendant which seems to unveil the past, present, and future of its onlooker all at once. Something feels as if this illustrious gem transcends even the very creations of the Gods themselves.
You gain Advantage on Attack Rolls, Ability Checks and Saving Throws, but roll [1] less on all dice.

These ancient jade beads pulsate with an otherworldly energy. As you hold them in your hand, you can't help but feel vibrations coursing through you, as if these beads are imparting a fragment of their storied power. This enchanted jewelry must have been used by a very sophisticated warrior, who came out victorious from impossible encounters.
Each turn in combat you gain Haste(if you don't have it) for [2] turns and Reverberation for [1] turns. You also gain +[1] to initiative.

This raven-shaped trinket conceals a profound secret, driven by the tadpole in your brain, an urge compels you to explore further. As your gaze fixates on the raven's eye, an astonishing transformation unfolds before you. The humble amulet in your hand undergoes a breathtaking metamorphosis, turning into a resplendent diamond. Simultaneously, the raven's penetrating gaze seems to delve deep into your very soul, bestowing upon you newfound powers. This ancient artifact's activation method is unlike any other you've encountered.
You take no fall damage and Dexterity Modifier is added to your physical attacks.

With its intricate design, valuable gemstones, and meticulous attention to detail, it becomes evident that this jewelry piece was commissioned by a noble prince. He clearly dedicated significant effort to perfecting this medallion, likely with the assistance of skilled artisans. In fact, it's clear he must have devoted more time to this astonishing masterpiece of jewelry than to his political duties. Otherwise, such an artifact would rest in the royal treasury, not in your possession.
At the start of each turn, you must succeed an Intelligence Saving Throw([1]) to gain Sudden Insight until the end of turn.

As you grasp this seemingly tiny pendant, an unexpected weight bears down upon you, as though it could wrench from your hand and anchor itself into the earth. After summoning your strength to overcome the enigmatic magic within, your attention is drawn to a startling discovery. Thick red liquid begins to flow from beneath the gemstone while a miniature snowstorm materializes from the other side. Before you can act, these two untamed forces converge at the heart of the stone, creating an explosive collision that releases an unprecedented surge of energy.

Your attacks deal an additional [1] and [2], but your movement speed is reduced by [3].

Triggers no more than once per turn.

Effectiveness increases every level.

Something about this ancient trinket immediately captures your interest, whether it's the intriguing copper casting technique or the eerie, pale pearl, shimmering with an unhealthy green hue. Upon touching the amulet, an unfamiliar and visceral fear courses through you from head to toe in an instant. It becomes clear that this piece of jewelry harbors potent dark magic and harnessing its power will require an unwavering resolve.
You ignore all Immunities, but lose two points from each Ability.

The moment your fingers make contact with this pendant, a sudden jolt of electricity courses through you! An astonishing trinket, to be sure! Yet, you realize enduring this shock may be the key to unlocking a potent magical enchantment. After bracing through a minute of pain, your suspicions begin to pay off as the strange stone, resembling a dark sea wave in color, begins to emit a dull blue glow, now appearing ready to enhance your spells.

While dealing[2] with a spell, you also deal [1].

Effectiveness increases from Spellcasting Ability Modifier.

Your gaze falls smoothly upon an intriguing glowing stone. Legends speak of stones like these as inventionsâ€”crafted by ancient alchemists who infused them with magically protective powers. One such legend tells of an enchanted alchemical stone, which was used to repel an entire glacier! Yet, this one carries an unbearable odor, as if it's urging you to reconsider wearing it.
You gain Immunity to[1], but roll [2]~[3] less on Attack Rolls.
After each Long Rest, you receive [1]~[2] random potions.

This exquisite pendant has a captivating appearance, which serves to conceal its hidden magic. To the discerning eye, barely visible runes etched onto the crystal's sides become apparent. While runes are typically considered to possess modest enchantments with their own flaws, keeping this piece could prove to be quite useful.

You gain a +[1] to your ranged spell Attack Rolls.

Effectiveness increases every [4] levels.

This austere work of high elven craftsmanship appears untouched by the passage of time. A subtle radiance emanates from the set gemstones, signaling a potent enchantment upon this item. Closer inspection reveals enhancements that will undoubtedly elevate proficiency in handling a wide range of matters, from intrigue to diplomacy.
You roll [1] more on all Ability Checks.

Before even touching this item, you immediately recognize it as a potent deity artifact. The identity of the craftsman remains a mystery, but their devotion to Malar, the deity of the hunt, is unmistakable. The amulet, when worn, imparts a sense of beastly power â€” a formidable gift. However, you should exercise caution when meddling with the talismans of such cruel deities.

+[1] to Athletics. Humanoids attacking you have Disadvantage on Attack Rolls. Difficult terrain does not slow you down.

Effectiveness increases every [2] levels.

Judging by the intricacy of the casting, you discern that this pendant held immense importance within the ancient royal dynasty of dwarves. As you heat it slightly, your admiration deepens, noting the remarkable durability of the gold alloy. A faint crackle captures your attention from within. After extensive testing, you uncover the pendant's enchantmentâ€”it forms a protective magical aura that slows incoming projectiles. This newfound knowledge hints at the power it holds, which, if not tempered, could lead to more daring actions.
When subjected to ranged attacks, damage received is reduced by an amount equal to double your Strength Modifier. You roll [1] lower on all Saving Throws.

A bone-chilling cold courses through your body as you touch this extraordinary pin. The unfamiliar magic compels you to affix the item beneath your heart. However, once you do, an overwhelming sensation of impending doom washes over you. It's clear that this artifact is no jest: the pin's design and the potency of its enchantment eerily harken back to the dark magic of ancient knights.

You deal [1] with melee weapon attacks, as long as you have [2]% HP or less.

Effectiveness increases every [3] levels.

When you gaze upon this amulet, an uncanny sensation of snowflakes seems to emanate from it, though your eyes can't quite grasp this illusion. Curiosity prompts you to touch the item, but as soon as your hand makes contact, a searing, murderous cold scorches your palm. It's evident that a potent magic is bound to this ancient artifact, compelling you to study it further.

You gain +[1] to Stealth, and your attacks also deal [2], as long as you are obscured.

Effectiveness increases from Dexterity Modifier.

After donning this pendant around your neck, an undeniable compulsion washes over you, urging you to seek out ice. Upon contact with a fragment of frozen water, a powerful surge of magical energy courses through you. The origins of the peculiar enchantment gracing this pendant remain shrouded in mystery, but you have a reasonable belief that it's tied to the passing of a powerful sorcerer. It's presumed that their soul became entwined with the object upon their demise, granting it unnatural attributes.

You gain +[1] to spell or cantrip Attack Rolls.

Effectiveness increases every [2] levels.
Entering the frozen surface, you gain Queen's Soul for [1] turns.

The light emitted from this brilliant yellow gemstone is so blinding that one cannot escape its radiant glare. After finally managing to don this peculiar jewelry, you feel the very essence of solar energy infusing you, enhancing your abilities. This leaves you wondering - how did the previous paladin who wielded this piece of jewelry meet their demise?

When you deal[1], target must succeed a Constitution Saving Throw or be blinded for [2] turns. You become Vulnerable to[1].

Duration of blinding increases every [3] levels.
Contains various tools of any professional Arcanizer: astral gems, enchanted dust, and luminous shards. Not intended for regular gameplay!

Terrifying in its appearance, this item, as you discerned with a careless glance, possesses intriguing magical properties. It likely exchanged hands through a sale with one of the Red Wizards, or was taken from their cold corpse. It dawns on you that this jewelry could prove quite advantageous in battle.
The Unknown Power of the Bloody Amulet

Intimidation +[1]. You begin burning for [3] turns, while in combat and not burning. You also deal [2] with all attacks on a foes.

Effectiveness increases every [4] levels.

You took an interest in this inconspicuous amulet adorned with a giant pearl at its core. It shimmers beautifully with colors from the sea, giving the impression waves are attempting to burst forth from within. Upon closer examination, you deduce that it's one of the minor Aquamancer Amulets employed in various rituals. Could it possibly be used to conjure a bath?

You get wet for [2] turns and create a puddle of water([1]) around you when you take damage. Water washes away all other surfaces.

Triggers no more than once per turn.

You've never encountered such a marvel of a device before. Its smooth metal surface, intricate mechanical hands, various knobs, and an eerie, dim magical light, all hint at the craftsmanship of gnome masters. Intrigued, you seek out a passing gnome to inquire about the nature of this object. They gladly explain that it's the Great Temporal Mechanism, capable of starting, stopping, and even transporting its owner through time itself. However, this oneâ€™s been broken for quite some time now.

At first glance, this amulet appears unremarkable, caked beneath layers of dirt and grime. When exposed to sunlight, however, you notice that the metal doesn't reflect ordinary light - instead emitting an otherworldly pale green glow. Curiosity drives you to delve deeper into ancient treatises, where you unearth unsettling revelations. It becomes evident that this artifact is best left untouched and your instincts advise either disposing of it, or selling it immediately.

-[2] to AC. When you deal damage to a humanoid that has [1]% HP or less - it instantly takes [3].

Effectiveness increases every level.

As you fixate your gaze upon the bottomless, radiant void nestled within this shattered antique locket, an insidious trance overcomes you. Recognizing the perilous nature of this artifact, you carefully conceal it within your bag, its enigma beckoning you to explore further. Later, studying the locket in closer examination on your unwary companion, you uncover its rich history. Once a vessel of formidable power, the remnants of its might now lie scattered across the world, hinting at the untold potential of the Astral Plane, forever eluding your grasp.

You are invulnerable to attacks that deal [1] or less damage.
When taking actions, the locket may occasionally banish you into the Astral Plane.

You promptly identify this pendant as an integral element of tribal shamanic practices. Typically, such jewelry bears only a modest enchantment, yet it holds a trace of nature's essence, making it valuable to mages of various disciplines.
When you miss a foe with a spell, you gain Storm Assist for [1] turns.

An impeccably clean item! You've never encountered a piece of jewelry so pristine in all your travels; it's as if a grain of dust fears to land upon it. You attempt to soil the magical trinket with dirt, but it remains utterly unscathed. Within, a radiant light seems to come alive inside the crystal sphere, as if seeking to break free. - Evidently, apart from its self-cleansing properties, this pendant infuses its wearer with the power of light magic.

You also deal [1] with all attacks for each particle of incinerating light.

Particles cannot be more than [2] and they fade over time.
Healing in combat gives you a [2]% chance to gain [1] Particle of Incinerating Light.

You've stumbled upon an exceedingly ancient piece of jewelry, evidently once belonging to one of the Druid groves. Judging by its remarkably well-preserved state, this talisman must have held great significance in the rituals of a long-forgotten commune. Encased in tree bark, a greenish stone seems to pulse gently with the sun's glow, imbuing a sense of kindness upon the beholder. As you reach out to touch it, an instant connection with nature courses through you. But one can't help but wonder - did this artifact bring about the downfall of its creators?
Nature +[1], vegetated terrain no longer affects you.

This amber stone, marred by numerous cracks, instilled a persistent sense of unease within you. It didn't appear ordinary, prompting you to embark on a series of experiments aimed at unveiling its hidden magical attributes. Through a sequence of intricate tests, you made a startling discovery â€“ the stone responds peculiarly to the absence of daylight, emanating a scarlet red glow from within. To harness its magical potential, you now realize it must be kept close to your head. Thus, you've affixed a pristine silver pendant to the stone.
Being out of sunlight and having less than [2]% HP you regain [1] at the start of each turn.

You can distinctively recall the tales from countless manuscripts, each one proclaiming the existence of a fabled great artifact, declaring, "those whom shall ever gather all the relics of the Supreme Paladin, doth ascend to Godhood." - And now, standing before you, is one of these very artifacts. Its exquisite power envelops you, while the luminous light within the stone fortifies your very essence. What intrigues you the most is that the pendant remained dormant until it found its way to you. Was it a mere twist of fate, or was it destiny?

Attacking an uninjured foe, you instantly regain a third of your HP. You are Resistant to[1].

Triggers no more than once per turn.

While you peer into the flawlessly polished ruby, you discern subtle movements from within the gem. Upon closer inspection, you observe tiny red faeries engaged in an never ending circular dance. Startled by your gaze, they emit hisses, but swiftly regain their composure and somehow appear willing to perform magic on your behalf. - Still, how exactly they may aid you remains to be seen.

You regain [1] at the end of each turn.

Effectiveness increases every [2] levels.

Entering rage, you gain Red Fairy Magic for [1] turns.

Triggers no more than once per combat.

On the back of the slightly charred pendant is carved in thick letters: "May peace of mind come to all who wear this jewelry". Apparently, the former wearers did find peace after all. Yet, you remain perplexed by the activation method of this artifact. Perhaps the magician who originally enchanted it lacked expertise, or perhaps some other magical essence tainted the pendant before it came into your possession.
You gain Advantage on Saving Throws to maintain Concentration, while standing on a surface covered in ash.

You attempt in vain to grasp the jewelry with your hands, but it continuously eludes your grip, as though it's coated in oil. The exquisitely cut emerald gleams playfully, almost as if it's mocking your efforts to seize it. Could this enchanted piece of jewelry require a particularly deft touch?
When you miss with an unarmed attack, regain a Bonus Action Point.

It's not difficult to identify this weathered gem - an ancient, magical lazurite that responds to any attempts to destroy it with magic. One of its more distinct side effects is driving anyone within close proximity to madness once activated. Nevertheless, this pendant has been modified by someone, diminishing the severity of these side effects, making it a valuable asset for you.
You gain +[1] to Spell Save DC, but take [2] at the end of your turn.
When you take spell damage, you gain Fury of Lazurite for [1] turns.

It's incredibly easy to become entranced by the alluring pearl at the center of this amulet; lost in the thoughts it conjures. Shaking yourself free from this magical fascination, you adorn the amulet. Upon doing so, you sense that the artifact has previously stolen an imprint of your thoughts and now holds them within it. Devilishness! That is, unless you harness this unfamiliar magic for your own gain.

At first glance, this exquisitely crafted pendant appears devoid of any extraordinary properties. You even attempted to bite the diamond, only to chip off a piece of your tooth. A mere trinket, one might think. Yet, its beauty is simply enchanting...

At first glance, it appears to be a finely crafted piece of machinery, with a hint of subtle magic imbued within. However, there are no apparent signs of activation. Suddenly, you notice groove stamps â€“ perhaps this ring has a second part?

You gain Acrobatics +[1] and Sleight of Hand +[1] if you wear the second part of the gnomish ring. You also shrink in size.

Effectiveness increases every [2] levels.
After twirling this seemingly useless iron in your hands, you've concluded that this gnome handicraft may not serve any immediate purpose to you. But then again, who knows?
You slightly shrink in size and reduce your size class by [1].

The sight of this unassuming ring sends shivers down your spine, as if it has absorbed all the malevolent sorcery emanating from its previous possessor. Once you wear it, you come to the unsettling realization that in your direst moments, you might find salvation in harming your comrades. A truly fearsome artifact.

All your attacks against allies deal [3] additional damage.

Regain [2] when dealing damage to allies.
Triggers no more than once per turn.

Effectiveness increases every level.

With some effort to focus your gaze, you manage to decipher the inscription inside the ring: "Enchanted this ring from a local wizard, wear it for good! - O.E." It appears to possess a mild form of health-enhancing magic indeed.

You admire the ring's remarkable combination of being exceptionally lightweight and incredibly durable. However, you canâ€™t shake the feeling it might possess a touch of nature's charm. Your intuition is soon proved correct when you make contact with the ground as wild vines burst forth!
When dealing damage to a foes, you summon wild vines under them for [1] turns.

You experience an immediate surge of tranquil and wisdom-infused energy as you make contact with this jewelry. The infinitely deep malachite patterns appear to unveil new avenues for meditation, granting you insight into the very essence of magic's creation. This artifact is undeniably a valuable keepsake!

You've encountered whispers of this magical mineral before. Known as the "Heart of the Ocean", it's a potent magical ore said to have been mined in limited quantities by an ancient underwater kingdom from deep within the depths of the sea. The gem before you possesses a unique, bubbly structure and radiates warmth upon touch, suggesting the existence of various varieties.

At the end of each turn, succeed a Constitution Saving Throw([1]) to regain all HP.
Regardless of Saving Throw, you will also take [2].
You gain Resistance to[2]. Stepping onto a water surface, you gain Boiling Water Trial for [1] turns.

Upon wearing the ring, an inexplicable surge of aggression fills your heart. Yet, as you attune yourself to the magical energy of this peculiar oak ring, you discover it can be harnessed and directed towards your enemies. It appears to have once been wielded by a powerful battle mage in the past.

Deal [1] to a foe that dealt damage to you.

Triggers no more than once per turn.

Effectiveness increases every level.

You've become quite enamored with this dusty amber ring. It exudes an untamed power, an enchantment that surpasses your understanding. And indeed, upon donning the ring, you experience a sudden, dramatic increase in size! Can you now effortlessly lift heavy stones?
You increase your size class and weight class by [1].

The opulent metal alloy speaks volumes - this ring was crafted in the royal foundries of a long-lost advanced empire. The artistry of the jewelry distinctly indicates it was meant for the upper echelons, likely courtiers of a noble assembly. The magical insignia, on the other hand, hints that this ring possesses not just ornamental beauty - but also intriguing hidden properties.

One of the royal rings from a bygone era, fashioned from pewter alloy and gilded, albeit showing signs of wear over the centuries. The faint magical enchantment hints at its previous owner being a practitioner of magic. Yet, the question lingers: is the depicted figure on the ring that of a king or a magician?

You appear to have stumbled upon one of the earliest magic rings in existence! While its power may be modest, its historical significance is truly captivating. The runes inscribed on it appear to aid the wearer in channeling energy into healing streams.

If you have Lightning Charge, you regain [1] when taking damage.

Triggers no more than once per turn.

Effectiveness increases every [2] levels.

An ominous intuition warns you that this ring is a creation of malevolent beings, but you can't resist the temptation to slide it onto your finger. Instantly, you plunge into a nightmarish vision. From the depths of darkness, a drow cloaked in shadowy robes materializes and gently touches your forehead, seemingly bestowing new abilities upon you. When you awaken, you feel significantly stronger, yet there's an unsettling fog clouding your memory, making it challenging to recall the whereabouts of your possessions.

An uneasy feeling gnaws at you, suggesting that this ring is the creation of malevolent beings. Despite your reservations, you decide to slide it onto your finger. In that very moment, you plunge into a nightmarish vision where a drow, shrouded in dark robes, emerges from the shadows and touches your forehead, seemingly endowing you with newfound abilities. When you awaken, you sense that you've gained the power to foresee events two steps ahead, but somehow you were unable to lift the previous weight.

Considering its well-worn appearance, this bronze ring has evidently withstood the test of time, enduring for more than a dozen generations. Adorned with symbols that appear to reference a game unfamiliar to you, the moment you slip the ring onto your finger, those symbols briefly blaze with a blinding white light before fading away, leaving you infused with a mysterious surge of newfound strength.

The jade visage appears to depict that of an ancient maiden, perhaps from an elven high court judging by her headdress. Could this be one of the enchanted midwife rings used by the elves to facilitate childbirth? While you certainly won't be needing it for that purpose, the enchantment on this ring may prove quite useful for other endeavors.

At the end of each turn you regain [1]. Dispels when taking damage.

Effectiveness increases every [2] levels.
When healing with a spell, you apply Lifesaving Relief to the target for [1] turns.

This elegantly crafted, yet highly functional ring effortlessly conforms to the size of your finger. As you examine it, you notice a faint enchantment â€” a vestige of the artifact's former might, likely once owned by a noble court. Curiously, you test its effect: the ring's magic appears to synchronize with your movements, as if the spirit of a master swordsman were aiding you in your attacks.

Your melee weapon attacks deal an additional [1] for each charge of this effect. Dispels on miss.

Effectiveness increases every [2] levels.

When dealing melee damage to a foe, you gain [1] charges of Precision Sword Magic.

Triggers no more than once per turn.

It's difficult to avert one's gaze from this magnificent ancient ring. A brilliant stormy glow emanates from a notch in the center of the ring, unmistakably hinting at its magical prowess. After several hours of thorough testing, you deduce that the artifact was crafted by a tempest shaman, someone deeply attuned to the elements and skilled in imbuing them into magical items. Undoubtedly, a captivating item deserving of further investigation.
When you deal[1] in melee, non-large targets are pushed away from you by the ring's thunder force by [2].

This ring, crafted from a solitary crimson rubellite, exudes an unmistakable aura of the Underdark. It practically oozes... intrigue... deceit... death... Although it likely remains dormant for now, you can sense its malevolent magic straining to be unleashed. This ring is bound to deliver its fair share of unpleasant surprises to you.

+[1] to Deception.
You have Disadvantage on Attack Rolls against spiders.

The sinister aesthetic of this ring greatly appeals to you, as if it were custom-made to complement a truly menacing appearance. After much contemplation, you decide to cautiously don the ring, and at first, it seems like nothing has changed. However, as time passes, you notice a growing sense of irritability, culminating in an unfortunate incident where you accidentally shattered your beloved vial in a fit of rage. Through various tests, it becomes evident that this jewelry was likely created and enchanted by an outcast, a servant of Yeenoghu, and subsequently passed to a gnoll who twisted the artifact's magic for one purpose: to kill.
You regain all Movement Points when entering Bloodlust, and can cast Chieftain's Perseverance for free.
Apply <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="HASTE">Haste</LSTag> to yourself without spending resources.
When dealing a killing blow to a foe, you enter Bloodlust until the end of your turn.

This elegantly polished ring gleams brilliantly, a stark contrast to the darkness that surrounds it. A closer inspection reveals intricate details, mimicking the texture of snake skin, masterfully crafted. At first glance, it appears to be an ordinary trinket, but when you grasp the ring and whisper the incantations needed to activate its magic, an intense, searing pain surges through your palm. It becomes evident that this artifact carries a potent enchantment and seeks retribution against those who have wronged its master. The question now is, how can you establish mastery over it?
You take [1] at the start of each turn due to a phantom viper's bite, avenging its master!
When you are downed, attacker inflicted by a Vengeful Venom for [1] turns.

The thick, repulsive green slime on this ring repels your gaze, instinctively warning you against any contact. If there was a ring beneath the slime, it has undoubtedly succumbed to some dissolution. Upon closer inspection, it becomes apparent that this ring once possessed potent enchantments, but at some point, it encountered a slug that absorbed it. This mystical fusion seems to have unlocked entirely new possibilities for the artifact.
All non-allied creatures within [1] radius take [2] each turn.
The creature takes damage from the mucous ring while within [1] of it.
When stepping on acid surface, you gain Acid Spattering for [1] turns.

It's evident this ring was hastily crafted to accommodate the enchanted quartz embedded within it. The previous owner and the ring's intended purpose remain shrouded in mystery, but the ring's potent magical aura is immediately apparent. Yet, this newfound energy seems to exude a malevolent force you've never encountered before. Fascinated by its power, you've spent days studying the stone, which continually reveals new magical mysteries. The question remains, will you dare to harness its might?
+[1] to Arcana. Missing an enemy with a spell or cantrip deals [2] to the target and [3] to yourself.

You clasp the golden citrine ring in your hand, its weight imperceptible, a familiar yet potent charm. It's impervious to scratches or breaks; any attempt to mar it results in the weapon bouncing off harmlessly. As time passes, you realize the citrine shines most brilliantly in direct sunlight. Slipping it on beneath the scorching sun, you suddenly feel the sun's energy flow into your mind. A higher power evaluates your resilience and, with a brief pause, conjures a magical dome charged with solar force around you.

Attackers need to deal more than [2] damage to harm you. At the start of each turn you take [3].

Effect persists while you are within [1] of the citrine ring bearer.

Effectiveness increases every level.
While under sunlight, you and your allies within [2] gain Solar Force Dome.

This finely polished copper ring portrays a handsome young man in the prime of his life. Despite its composition, the ring bears an intricate design, clearly crafted in a royal workshop. It likely adorned the finger of a messenger tasked with delivering documents of great state importance in times past. However, whether this trinket possesses any power remains a mystery.
You gain +[1] to Armor Class for each charge of this effect.

Your weight class is reduced by [2]. Taking damage from a foe grants you [1] charges of Lightness.

Triggers no more than once per turn.

This peculiar piece of jewelry resembles more of a smoke ring, the kind you might blow from your mouth while smoking, but a closer examination in the light unveils the mystical nature of this artifact. Within the translucent, glass-like substance, a bluish otherworldly smoke swirls, captivating your senses. As you slide the ring onto your finger, you sense it beginning to resonate with your very living energy. Now, the question lingers â€” how to unlock the ring's latent power?
When a foe deals damage to you, you have a [3]% chance to become Invisible for [2] turn.

When you grip this ring, it vibrates intensely - you sense your body begin to sync with the rhythm of this peculiar object. The intensity of the shaking is remarkable. It's likely one of the Duergar rings, typically employed by executioners for more torturous deaths. You contemplate the possibility of tweaking the ring's enchantment to imbue it with more practical attributes. After all, you have no intentions of using it for torture... or do you?
Using a jump or fly, you deal [1] in a [2] radius while floating - to all foes and objects, and may cause them to fall Prone.

This ring exudes an unbearable stench of decaying flesh. Despite your attempts to cleanse it, the odor lingers persistently, hinting at a potent enchantment. Extensive investigation reveals an unsettling connection to a sinister practice involving the consumption of human flesh. Evidently, the charm on this ring facilitated the wearer's ability to endure the digestion of rot.

When killing a humanoid or scoring a Critical Hit against one, you regain [1].

Effectiveness increases every level.

This somber amethyst ring serendipitously found its way to you, as if guided by fate. Your intuition compels you to slip it onto your finger, and you heed this peculiar suggestion. In response, the ring emits a brilliant flash, bathing you in a radiant lilac glow. An instant later, you find yourself fiercely combating the drowsiness induced by the artifact's enchantment. As you triumph over the urge to sleep, a distinct surge of magical energy courses through you.
You gain +[1] to Spell Save DC, but in combat you must succeed a Wisdom Saving Throw([2]) or fall asleep.

This vibrantly hued wooden ring appears to have weathered numerous adventures and yet remains in nearly pristine condition. A nagging sense of peculiarity prompts you to delve into its true nature. After poring over numerous treatises on ancient artifacts, you conclude that you've come into possession of a magical relic that once belonged to an ancient martial arts master. The identity of this master and the martial arts they practiced shall forever remain shrouded in history's mists. Nonetheless, you're determined to find a purpose for this enigmatic item; one way or another.
You gain Proficiency with Simple Weapons and knowledge of Compelled Duel.

This finely crafted ring, shaped like a mythical rhinoceros, immediately caught your attention. Initially, nothing noteworthy happened when you first wore it. However, during a run, you unexpectedly became host to the tormented souls of the past trapped within this artifact; their collective presence attempting to assail your sanity. It's evident that this is a profoundly ancient item, once harnessed by a tribe for purposes as dark as slave hunting. Now, you must find a way to channel and control this formidable energy.
Add your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> to melee weapon <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>, but take [2] at the end of your turn.
When performing a Dash, you gain Fury of Souls until the end of your turn.

You were struck of this mineral, and its magical enchantment was readily apparent. The ring's material seems to radiate with the intensity of fire, as infernal fire tornadoes swirl in a furious dance within the gem. Without hesitation, you waste no time activating this powerful ancient artifact.
This creature leaves pools of fire beneath it and starts to burn. If creature dies before this effect ends, and creates a fiery explosion within [2], dealing [1] to surrounding creatures.
A foe who takes damage from your levelled spell must succeed a Constitution Saving Throw([1]) or recieve Internal Burning for [2] turns.

Initially, this delicate ring, crafted from woven pine needles, appeared utterly unremarkableâ€”neither valuable nor imbued with magic. Yet, something compelled you to pick it up and slide it onto your finger. You wore it for days, growing increasingly frustrated with its apparent lack of effect. Then, just at the point of contemplating discarding the trinket, the needles unexpectedly arranged themselves into the form of a tiny dryad who implored you not to abandon her to a dusty crate, promising her patronage in return. It puzzled you, as you had heard that dryads were bound to trees, so how could she reside within these needles?

You become Vulnerable to[2] and gain +[1] to ranged weapon Attack Rolls.

Effectiveness increases every [3] levels.

This beautifully crafted ring, featuring a highly detailed lion's head made of pure silver, speaks volumes about its previous owner. Such intricate jewelry isn't typically within the reach of commoners. Your deduction is reasonable: firstly, the ring was likely crafted by humans, and secondly, it might have adorned the finger of a noble soldier, perhaps even the town guard captain. Notably, since wearing the ring, you've found that your sleep quality has improved, and it imparts a positive influence upon you.

You gain Positive Attitude for [1] turns immediately after a Long Rest.

+[3] to Charisma(up to [4]) if you are a human (or disguised as one).

It doesnt take a scholar to know this ring was a creation of the elves. Their mastery of jewelry crafting and their ability to seamlessly blend artistry with functionality is unmistakable. The ring's robust alloy can withstand even the full impact of a sword, and the heart-leaf-shaped yellow gemstone appears to symbolize the very essence of nature's rhythm. Upon donning it, you sense the ring harbors a wellspring of vital energy, but it remains dormant unless in proximity to a source of water.
While standing in water, the power of the elven ring restores you [1] each turn.

This enchanted ring likely originates from the depths of the Underdark. Its rough finish and crudely melted gold core hint at its origins, possibly the work of dwarves, underground gnomes, or even drow. Whoever crafted this remarkable artifact, it appears to have been forged for nefarious purposes, harboring a malevolent magic within.
You gain +[2] to Strength(but no more than [3]) while not under sunlight, but in combat you must succeed a Constitution Saving Throw([1]) each turn or become permanently Petrified.

This ancient ring, made of quality silver alloy and embedded purple stone, is just as crazy expensive as it looks. From what you know, it's the kind of brutal yet regal sophistication that Baldurian nobility is known for. On top of that, this piece greatly improves your ability to convincingly tell lies when you put it on! Definitely, a fine addition to your collection.
You gain Proficiency and Advantage on Deception.

The dull green gemstone may have faded, but this ring still holds formidable power in the right hands. Delving into the depths of the artifact's magic, you uncover its intriguing history. It once belonged to a figure named Sharantyr, and the enchantment within the ring was a reward bestowed upon her by none other than Elminster himself, in recognition of her past deeds.
If your level is greater than or equal to [1], reduces the threshold for scoring a Critical Hit by [2].

This ring emanates a brilliant glow even within utter darkness, casting an ethereal radiance upon its surroundings. It's as though this magical piece has forever captured the scorching desert sun, the clear azure sky, and the earthly terrain, no longer mirroring the current world. You find yourself entranced by the ring's exquisite facets, feeling as if it's a gateway to some distant, untarnished realm. After careful inspection, it seems safe to assume that its properties could be harnessed, allowing you to tap into its formidable powers.
When you step on any surface, the ring's magic teleports it into nothingness.

At first glance, this slender ring, barely fitting on your smallest finger and adorned with a petite peach opal, appears devoid of any power. However, you refuse to be deceived, as ordinary rings often show signs of wear, while this one remains in pristine condition. You utter a few incantations, and true to your suspicions, the ring's latent power is unveiled, enhancing your magical prowess.

When dealing[2],[3] or[4] with a Cantrip, you also deal [1] damage.

Effectiveness increases every [5] levels.

This aquamarine ring, with its exquisite appearance, emanates a distinct magical energy. It appears to be a relatively recent artifact, likely originating from the Gates. Upon inspecting the inside of the ring, you find engraved letters that read, "Made and Enchanted by Oberon." Whoever this Oberon is deserves much appreciation, for this piece truly showcases an astonishing level of craftsmanship.
While within [1] of the aquamarine ring's bearer, the creature gains +[2] to Intelligence and +[3] to Spell Save DC.
If your Intelligence is greater than or equal to [1], all non-hostile creatures within [2] gain Mind Enhancement.

You examine the intricate smelting patterns and deduce that this ring must have been crafted by master artisans, possibly with royal connections. Upon wearing the ring, a surprising wave of awareness regarding FaerÃ»n's politics washes over you as well as thoughts about significant historical events begin to fill your mind. It's truly a fascinating discovery!

+[1] to History and Insight.

Effectiveness increases every [2] levels.

It appears you've encountered a cursed artifact from Avernus, the Nine Hells. The satanic flames within the smooth crystal surge violently as you grasp this ring. The immense weight of this artifact presses against your skin, causing a slight burning sensation. However, once you slide it onto your finger, all of the discomfort vanishes. Now, you're only left pondering what it might require to activate this devilish trinket.
Each turn in combat while Burning, you have a [3]% chance to create a lake of hellfire with radius [1] for [2] turns. Hellfire does not affect you.

This dazzling ring, adorned with numerous smooth, glistening moon gems, exudes a potent magical aura. It gives you the distinct impression that the hand of heaven itself has graced this artifact, leaving its mark. Upon wearing the ring, it resonates within your mind, flooding you with a surge of assured thoughts that provide answers to questions you've long struggled to resolve.

You fix your gaze upon this steel ring, which features an unassuming yellow stone. Its brilliance shines forth, revealing a polished surface, while beneath the newly applied lacquer, the stone's hidden depths seem to hold elusive mysteries that instantly pique your curiosity. However, this seemingly magical artifact appears resistant to your attempts to harness its power. Could it be that its secrets are meant for a more adept magic user to unveil?
You have a [1]% chance to recover all class Spell Slots after a Short Rest.

In accordance with legends, the Great Mother was regarded as the protector of bountiful harvests and warm hearths. You unmistakably identify the symbol of the deity on this ring, and curiously, it fills you with an immediate sense of warmth and contentment. The enchanting beauty of lush fields and fertile soil unfurls before your eyes, bringing tears of joy that you can't restrain. It's likely that this ring once belonged to a rural lord who harnessed its magic to navigate challenging seasons.
You become Resistant to[2]. When you step on mud, thick flower growth appears within [1] of you that doesn't slow you down.

You come across this ring, which appears to be crafted from an extraordinary alloy and adorned with brilliantly glowing hessonite gemstones. While familiar with the mineral, you've never witnessed it radiate with such an intense light, clearly suggesting the presence of magic. Through meticulous examination, you discern that the cut and setting style of this jewelry are unique to a specific human kingdom. Intriguingly, it appears that the enchantment was applied long after the ring's initial creation, leading you to surmise that it may have been a reward from the king to a distinguished knight who wore it for many years before the charm was added.

You roll [1] higher on Ability Checks and Saving Throws.

Dispels when you are hit.
When you kill a foe, you gain Tremendous Smugness for [1] turns.

You discovered this ring beneath a thick layer of dust and dried mud, but once you cleaned it, the smoothly polished jasper with dark jade inlays revealed itself. You considered it a great find, planning to sell it at a higher price to an unsuspecting buyer. However, the ring's insistent call tormented you, compelling you to put it on. Weary of the persistent summons, you finally relented and experienced an awakening â€” unlocking the secret of the ancient Six-Fingered Punch technique. Yet, the moment you removed the ring, the knowledge of this fascinating technique faded from your memory.

You deal [1] to a foe with an unarmed attack, even if you miss.

Can only trigger once per Long Rest.

Based on its appearance, little good could be anticipated from this ominous piece of jewelry. True to form, when you attempt to activate the ring's power, it swiftly and malevolently "infiltrated" you - infusing you with sinister energy, as if binding itself to your body! This ring appears to possess a will of its own, refusing to yield to your intentions for even a moment. It's a perilous trinket, even for a seasoned wizard â€” but you still decide to keep this cursed artifact.

At the start of each turn, this creature takes [1].

Effectiveness increases every level.

This creature receives a [1] penalty to Attack Rolls.

Effectiveness increases every level.
At the start of each turn, this creature creates cursed vines beneath itself within [1] for [2] turns.
This creature takes [1] when the effect is applied and [2] when it dispels.
When you attack a foe, the ring's evil essence can occasionally be unleashed, causing significant harm to the target â€” and to you.

This ancient, slender jade ring bears the scars of time, with its metal riddled with deep scratches and the jade severely cracked. It's clear that this jewelry has weathered more than a thousand years and remains surprisingly resilient. In an experimental moment, you decide to strike the ring with a hammer. To your astonishment, the hammer barely leaves a mark, and the ring seems almost unscathed. Suddenly, the artifact emits a dense healing mist, miraculously mending your old wounds.
When you take damage in combat, the ring releases healing mist, instantly healing all creatures within [1].

Examining this ring, you can't help but notice the strong enchantment attached to it. Hell, probably only a blind man would fail to notice how the metal on this piece of jewelry shimmers with all the colors of the rainbow! But what you notice the most is the pinkish-yellow hue - most likely signaling the original source of the magic. Unfortunately, you lack the experience to say for sure who was involved in the creation of the artifact, but one thing you know for sure - this ring reacts to changes in the wearer's mood, infusing them with miraculous resistant magic.

When any effect is applied to you in combat, you have a [1]% chance to gain Miraculous Magic for [3] turns and instantly regain [2].

Effectiveness increases every level.

The presence of the rare blue marble in this ring provides a subtle clue to its true origins. Subsequently, you delve into ancient texts, unveiling that the craftsmanship involved in working such a stone could only be attributed to the devout followers of a long-forgotten deity. This ring bears an enchantment to beckon the immortal sentinels of the temple. A wry chuckle escapes you as you realize that the defenders had evidently failed to invoke its power before meeting their demise.
As the temple ring's bearer, you summon two immortal melee guardians with exceptional combat capabilities to your defense.

You gaze upon this resplendent ring adorned with a giant purple sapphire, feeling an undeniable sense of destiny. However, your preoccupation isn't solely with the whims of fate, but rather your fervent desire to unravel the secret of the enchantment that undoubtedly lies within it. After attempting every conceivable incantation, you're left utterly disheartened. But then, a twist of fate itself intervenes as a passing citizen carelessly jostles you - instantly becoming your staunch ally. This revelation prompts you to delve further into your experiments, leading to the discovery that the enchantment responds to malevolent influences upon the wearer, compelling wrongdoers to align with their victim. The creator of this artifact was undoubtedly a masterful connoisseur of humanoid nature.

When you attacked by a humanoid, they must make a Wisdom Saving Throw or become your ally for [1] turns.

Effectiveness of DC is increases from your Spell Save DC.

You've stumbled upon an incredibly beautiful and exquisite ring. The small turquoise topazes intertwining around the noble metal seems to radiate with even greater brilliance once it's placed upon your finger. Admiring the craftsmanship, you promptly discern the presence of a magical enchantment. One of your companions recalls a similar artifact: an ancient and stunning "Ring of a Thousand Topazes" known to bestow its wearer with the blessing of precise and lethal strikes. There's only one way to confirm if this is indeed the right ring.
Your next weapon attack shall score a double <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag>.
When scoring a Critical Hit with a weapon, you gain Deadly Strike for [1] turns.

Just an average metal ring, certainly not the prettiest of looks. Before you can get a good look at the ring, you drop it into the water! When you pick it up, you notice writing slowly appearing on the inside of the ring: "May the one who does not lose heart in the most difficult hour be protected from the evil army of warriors." An interesting phrase, but what could it possibly mean? No one just leaves enchanted inscriptions on steel rings, so there is magic involved, and quite powerful indeed.
When below [1]% HP, you ignore half of all[3],[4],[5] taken and gain +[2] to Constitution.

It's not hard to assume the magical nature of this item when everything around it freezes. You hadn't originally intended to claim this oversized crystal ring for yourself, but the promise of powerful abilities makes it tempting to try. The ring is so large that you have to wear it more like a bracelet, almost at your elbow. Once adorned, you immediately feel the cold's grasp recede, as if you have become a cold conductor. Strangely, your companions share a similar sensation. However, it is unmistakable that the frost now favors your movements, aiding you in battle. Such rings aren't casually found; someone likely sacrificed many lives to wrest this artifact from its previous master.
While within [1] of the crystal ring's bearer, you gain Resistance to[4], +[3] to Movement Speed and freeze the ground within [2] around you. Ice doesn't knock you Prone.
You gain an aura that affects you and your allies within [1], making them Frost Conduits. While standing on ice, you gain +[2] to AC.

You've come into possession of a magnificently enchanted ring, and it's certain to be of great use! At first glance, it's evident that this is no ordinary ring, but one blessed by the light of the goddess Waukeen, who governs matters of wealth. The use of incredibly pure gold and the smoothly polished muddy citrine is a hallmark of refinement when crafting an artifact in homage to this goddess. However, the enchanter behind this ring appears to have possessed a sense of humor, as the ring brazenly teleports gold, which originally belonged to someone else, beneath the feet of any individual who meets their end while you are wearing the ring. Clearly, this artifact is not intended for mere peddlers...
Magic Bag of Other Men's Gold
When you kill a foe, the ring's power teleports others' gold in a magical pouch right under the corpse.

This ring is quite eerie. The blood-red, cracked gemstone appears to have been forcefully wedged haphazardly into its metal setting, which has become rather shabby over the hundreds of years it has traveled the world. This magical artifact reeks of some unfathomable, ancient force that you've never been able to subdue the possession of. Yet here it is, right there, encased in this unkempt antique ring, ready to be harnessed. A temptation you findâ€¦ increasingly difficult to refuse?
Your next weapon attack against a creature will deal [1], even if you miss.
When you miss with a weapon attack, you gain Fury of Failure until your next attack and immediately deal [1] to the target.

You could ponder the origins of this ring indefinitely, debating whether it was crafted by ancient druids, powerful wizards, or monks. However, time and patience are in short supply. The primary objective is to uncover the means to activate this magnificent ring adorned with a perfectly faceted rosy spinel. You're well aware that this artifact exudes a soothing aura, but despite tens of hours of experimentation, the activation method remains elusive. Deciding that "night is the mother of counsel," you choose to don the ring as you retire for the night. To your astonishment, upon awakening, both you and your companions feel a surge of power akin to the radiant dawn sun!
While within [1] of the spinel ring's bearer, you gain +[2] to AC, and attackers have Disadvantage on Attack Rolls against you.
Immediately after a Long Rest, you gain an aura that affects you and your allies within a radius of [2] and grants Peaceful Magic for [1] turns.

You take this interesting looking ring in your hand, and already realize how much use you can make of this magical trinket. The green embedded crystallite glows much brighter when you hold it up to Scratch, and you begin to understand that with the ring on your hand, you are able to penetrate the beast's mind and give it commands more clearly.
At the start of combat, your allied beasts gain Mental Control for [1] turns.

This creature's attacks are directed by the Beastmaster. It gains +[1] to Attack Rolls.

Effectiveness increases every [2] levels.

This ring is quite massive. You seem barely able to put it on or even lift it. However, something told you that the reason for this was the magic lock, which opens only after a long meditation. And indeed, after meditating, you lifted the ring like a trifle and felt a sudden lightness in your body when you put it on.

Missing unarmed attack on a foe regains [1] Ki Points to you.

Triggers no more than once per combat.

You appreciated the appearance of this shiny trinket: a cast brass base, battered for thousands of years, and a brutal black gemstone leading the composition of this jewelry. The ring seemed to have had immense capabilities for a fighter, but over the years its abilities had become far weaker.
You always hit first attack in combat with a ranged weapon.
Your next ranged weapon attack is guaranteed to hit a foe.

The ring is a rather beautiful piece of magical art. The clear resin stone, set on a sturdy oak base, seems to glow bright crimson from within, inviting you into the dark recesses of an ancient consciousness, a being that once, day and night, led the Brown Hunt. You cannot deny yourself the pleasure of trying on this beautiful ring.
Movement Speed is reduced by [1]. When dealing damage to a foe, you restore [2]% of your Movement Points.

When you put this brass trinket on your finger, you suddenly felt a gradual sensation. This feeling was impossible to describe: it was as if your soul was trying to be gathered into a ball, and then sculpted from this ball into strange prehistoric animal forms. After walking with this ring long enough, you began to notice that the practicing for your soul was not in vain, endowing you with extraordinary magical capabilities.
Each turn in combat you gain one charge of Planar Soul Enhancement.

You take [1] at the end of each turn in combat.

Does not dispels after Long Rest.
After gaining [1] charges of Planar Soul Enhancement, you absorb them and are fulfilled for [2] turns.
+[1] to Intelligence, Wisdom and Charisma until the first spell you cast.

Who would believe you if you said you'd discovered a ring that changes a person's destiny? A truly strange find, this ring: a cosmic dark stone, framed in a noble but ancient metal, seems to radiate the very energy of the cosmos. Some very powerful wizard has imprisoned the star itself inside the stone, but you fail to harness that power to its fullest. All your skills have been able to do is force the ring to guide your attacks.
You add [1] extra damage dice to your melee and throwing Critical Hits(including spells), but roll [2] less on all dice.

The beautifully faceted opal stares back at you with its soulless but rather bright eye, seemingly sucking inside itself all the heat around it. You notice that the metal of the ring is covered with a faint layer of soot. It seems that the owner of this magical artefact has been in more than one trouble, and the ring helped him to cope with fire-breathing creatures. Or to avoid overcooking the meat on the fire? Though, the centuries have not passed in vain for this piece, and now it is clearly not in the best shape.
Taking damage in combat from an attack or fire, you gain [1] charge of Unstable Fire Shield. With a small chance, you may gain [1]~[2] additional charges.
You receive [1] less for each charge of this effect. If there are more than [3] charges, effect dispels and a pool of fire within [2] radius appears beneath you.

Judging by its appearance, the amulet has passed through many centuries, and even an experienced wizard will not be able to determine the origin of the enchantment, nor will a skilled blacksmith be able to figure out what metal the relic was made of. What is clear to you is that the amulet reveals quite an unusual reaction next to natural born sorcerers and unleashes an energy of unprecedented, almost infinite power.
By casting an evocation spell in combat, you spend [1] Sorcery Point and gain Arcane Acuity for [2] turns.

The bottomless lettuce-colored jewels stare back at you like two pairs of eyes of an utterly hideous creature. Despite the artful finish, the overall feel of this ancient artifact seems to give off an unimaginably malevolent aura that dims fire and wilts flowers.
Upon entering combat, you gain Aura of Decay, affecting all creatures and items in a [1] radius, including you.

This creature or item stops burning and becomes vulnerable to[2].

Dispels at the end of combat, or if the entity moves out of range of this aura.

After hours of reading long historical treatises, you find out that this is a fairly regular piece of equipment among the wizards of Birocchi, who inflicted terror on military camps hundreds of years ago, driven by the belief that all wars can only be stopped when the warrior bloodline, the warrior dynasty, is annihilated. They believed that if only the children of blacksmiths and shopkeepers remained in the world, there would be no one left to wage war. Well, they didn't achieve their ultimate mission anyway, but at least their excellent artifacts would be useful to warrior descendants.
Killing a foe, gain [1] charge of Birocchi's Charm, but take [2].
If the charges become [1] or more, you absorb them and regain one Level [2] Spell Slot< /LSTag>, as well as Level [3] with a [5]% chance, as well as Level [4] with a [6]% chance.

At first, it appeared nothing more than a simple, albeit elegant, trinket â€” yet its beauty was undeniable, drawing your gaze irresistibly. There was something unsettling about it, a faint, almost imperceptible scent â€” like spoiled milk lingering in the air, clinging stubbornly to your thoughts. When you clasped the talisman around your neck, a low, mournful whisper crept into your mind. A voice, hollow with despair, pleaded for freedom â€” its soul was imprisoned within, it said. Break the figure of the brain, and its mind would be released from this eternal torment. Your hand moved towards the figurine, ready to comply, when your eyes caught a faint inscription on the back: "Do not release â€” it will take your body." The pleas grew louder, more frantic, but your resolve hardened. You set the talisman aside, haunted by the knowledge that the soulâ€™s freedom would come at a far greater cost â€” your own.

When you are attacked by a spell, you may apply Mind Fatigue to the attacker for [1] turns.

You always take [2] less.

This creature suffers Disadvantage on Concentration Saving Throws. Deals [1] the first time effect is applied.

Dispels at the end of combat.
One of the rare rings forged with the dark forces of Shar, purified with light magic and gifted to the mighty paladins of SÃ©lune. These rings are now almost impossible to find.
Enemies within [1] become vulnerable to[2] unless they are Immune to it.

Within the crystal's heart dances a single droplet from the mythical Well of Medusae, sealed therein by the dwellers of a long-lost monastery. Upon the worn and tarnished metal, ancient Aquan runes whisper their eternal truth: "To embrace paralysis is to know the mercy of the depths".

While you are in a Paralyzed state, your HP and Ki Points are restored to maximum at the end of each turn.

Your Movement Speed is reduced by [1].

Rare amethyst crystals, infused with energy from interplanar rifts. An artificier from Silverymoon set them in this ring in a specific pattern, creating a miniature singularity capable of collapsing small matter. However, each compression leaves a tiny tear in the fabric of reality, through which something occasionally peers from the void.

All Tiny creatures within [1] of you must make a Constitution Saving Throw([2]) â€” or be instantly compressed to death by the ring's power. A successful compression may spawn a hostile creature from the Astral Plane.

If a creature succeed a Saving Throw, it is no longer subject to the Compressor's power. The ring's magic remains with you until a Long Rest, even if you remove it.
An interplanar singularity hovers above you, compressing to death all Tiny creatures within [1].
An interplanar singularity hovers above you, compressing to death all Tiny creatures within [1].
The creature has passed the interplanar singularity trial and is now immune to it until it kills another creature. It also seems to have grown larger for some reason?
The Berbalang can see over vast distances, even through walls, and can detect invisible creatures.
The Berbalang gains a +[1] bonus to Dexterity and Intelligence Saving Throws. All its Attack Rolls gain a +[1] bonus.

This prism is a shard of shattered reality from Limbo. Within it are contained fragments of different planes of existence, constantly merging and diverging in a chaotic dance. When the bearer suffers a powerful blow, the prism momentarily opens, and the laws of adjacent dimensions invade the surrounding space with unpredictable consequences.
When you receive a Critical Hit, the prism substitutes reality for [1] turns, and may sometimes apply a random side effect for [2] turns.
All creatures within [1] of you are unable to take any actions.
You cannot take any actions while the liquefied space anomaly affects you.
Disadvantage on Wisdom, Intelligence, and Charisma <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Checks</LSTag>.
You've summoned a small Redcap that was experimented on by Waterdeep mages. You'll have to finish it off!
You take [1] more damage from all spells, but also deal [1] Damage more with your spells and cantrips.
You lose [1]% HP at the end of each turn if you're not Wet. While Wet, you restore [1]% HP at the end of each turn.
You increase your size class and weight by [1], and damage from weapon and unarmed attacks by +[2]~[3].

An ancient ring stolen from the tomb of the long-forgotten necromancer Para'xee. The green crystals are fragments of soul essence extracted from countless victims. At the slightest touch of death, they resonate, releasing a destructive echo of necrotic energy.

When you deal[1], all creatures within [2] of the target take [3].

Triggers no more than once per turn.

Forged in the heart of the Elemental Plane of Fire from an alloy of obsidian and flame crystal. The last relic of the efreeti Azhar, whose name became synonymous with destruction on the Material Plane. The ring's bearer gains the power of a fire lord, but the flame burns from within, a never-extinguishing reminder of the price of power.

When someone within [1] of you takes[2], they additionally take [3].

Damage from your[2] spells or cantrips is doubled.

You are always Burning (even outside of combat!).

Living mercury from the laboratory of the mad alchemist Tirrius Argent, enchanted with reagents of unknown origin. It continuously changes shape at the micro level, spraying tiny droplets of caustic substance with each surge of magical energy. Even the masters of the Waterdeep Alchemists' Guild couldn't unveil the secret of its unstable nature.

When dealing damage with a cantrip or spell, you also deal [1] [2]~[3] times.

Triggers no more than once per turn.
